    • Method Detail

      • process

        public ij.ImagePlus process()
        Description copied from class: ClusteringTechnique
        Performs the actual processing for this clustering technique. This class returns a dynamic image with n + 1 frames, with n being the total number of clusters formed, following the convention as follows:

        • From the first frame to the n-th frame, individual clusters are represented
        • The last frame (n + 1) shows all the clusters in the image simultaneously. The first cluster gets a value of 1, the second one a value of 2... non-analyzed voxels get a value of 0.
        In order to return this structure, the developer may just fill a regular ImagePlus structure with each voxel containing the value of the cluster that voxel belongs to (1-based) and then use the Utils.expand(ImagePlus, int) method. The int value that this method needs will always be (except weird cases) the one obtained via clusters.size().

        Please note that the minimum cluster number must be 1, not 0.

        This class must also build an ArrayList, with each element being a Cluster object.

        Specified by:
        process in class ClusteringTechnique
        Returns:
        A dynamic image representing each cluster following the previous convention.
